Innovate Summit 2017

Brno, Czech Republic

December 14, 2017

>

About The Conference

SolarWinds Innovate is headed to Brno, Czech Republic on December 14th, 2017!

Innovate is a one-day event and a great opportunity for you to meet and learn from SolarWinds engineers and others in the monitoring community.

Spend the day hearing talks from experts and fellow devs on topics ranging from in-field issues to cutting-edge technology that you should be keeping an eye on. Finish the day off with a social happy hour, where you can network and just get to know your local monitoring community a little better.

We are passionate about monitoring solutions, and we're excited to pull together a group that shares that passion and is interested in keeping up with how the industry is growing and evolving.

Register

It's free!

We have limited availability, so we encourage you to sign up as soon as possible to ensure you'll have a spot. On conference day, we'll have a rolling check-in beginning at noon.

What entry gets you:

  • Talks from experts
  • Networking opportunities with fellow devs and industry professionals
  • Access to the social happy hour
  • Free swag!

Karlo Zatylny

Principal Architect
SolarWinds

Integrating intelligent algorithms into software that yields immediate customer value is my top priority. Whether through data analytics or the integration of new technology, I aim to architect software solutions that give the users an advantage in their daily jobs.

×

Lee Calcote

Head of Technology Strategy
SolarWinds

Lee is an innovative thought leader who is passionate about building best-in-class teams and offerings, with a solid record of leveraging advanced and emerging technologies for competitive advantage, improving processes and speed of delivery on the way to driving revenue and market share.

With nearly 20 years of combined technical, management and leadership experience with globally distributed, agile teams throughout full software development lifecycle. I look to profoundly impact by leading strategy and development of product and delivery of services at the intersection of clouds, containers, networks, systems and applications.

About Brno

City Info

The students’ city. Czech’s Silicon Valley. Second largest. A capital of Moravia. These are a few of many epithets that describe this vibrant city full of cafés, bars, bistros, high-tech companies, and three large universities with more than 90,000 students in total. Each year, Brno hosts plenty of cultural and sporting events, expos, and technical conferences, and it is home to one of SolarWinds' offices, located in the Spielberk Office Centre just south of the Svratka river.
